node.title: To unlock the mysteries of the Omicron variant, this scientist must first grow the virus in his lab
node.alt: A man in a white hazmat suit looks at a computer in a laboratory
node.description: While the world was busy making other plans, Omicron had already begun its quiet evolution. Now scientists are frantically studying the mysterious new variant so we can understand what we're fighting.
node.content:
["Every day for the last week, Thumbi Ndung'u and his team of researchers have spent hours inside a room with the world's most feared coronavirus variant.", "To keep themselves from becoming infected, they pull on white plastic cover-alls and wear industrial respirators slung around their waists.", "While the rest of the world braces for the possible spread of the new Omicron variant, Professor Ndung'u is doing something seemingly counterintuitive: He's growing it in a laboratory.", "His team is among a vanguard of scientists across the world racing to examine the mysterious new variant under tightly controlled conditions\u00a0to understand how it behaves.", "Omicron, more a distant cousin than a direct descendent of the Delta variant, has strange and concerning features.\u00a0", "In the worst-case scenario, this evolution could mean a more transmissible version of COVID-19, with the ability to evade existing vaccines.\u00a0", "For Professor Ndung'u, a Harvard-educated virologist from the Africa Health Research Insitute in Durban, none of that is certain until he and his colleagues do their work.", "\"What we have been doing so far is speculate,\" he said.\u00a0", "\"This is a very important next step.\"", "
The three big questions about Omicron\u00a0
", "Although the variant has already driven governments the world over to slam borders shut and healthcare systems to bristle, there is still remarkably little known about Omicron.", "", "
While the origins of Omicron are still being investigated, some countries have closed their borders to southern Africa.\u00a0(AP:\u00a0Jerome Delay)
", "What began with reports of a new variant first identified in Botswana and South Africa late last month has now grown to a smattering of cases in Europe, the US and Australia, where authorities remain on high alert.", "There are three key questions about the variant that are yet to be answered: How transmissible it is, how effective\u00a0current vaccines will be against it, and what severity of symptoms it might cause in those infected?", "In the absence of much real-world data on\u00a0how Omicron affects human populations, laboratory testing is needed to see just how dangerous it is.\u00a0", "But the world is in for an anxious wait. Results may still be some weeks away.", "For\u00a0Professor Ndung'u and his team,\u00a0unlocking the secrets of the variant is what they do best.\u00a0", "\"From a scientific point of view, it's exciting,\" he said.\u00a0", "Even so, some South African doctors who have treated patients infected by Omicron are adamant the variant is different to what they have encountered in previous waves, though there is not enough data yet to decide that.", "
The GP who spotted Omicron in her patients
", "Angelique Coetzee, a GP at a family practice in Pretoria, was among the first to raise the alarm over Omicron with South African authorities last month.", "So far, Dr Coetzee estimates she has\u00a0seen about 30 patients infected with Omicron come through her clinic.\u00a0", "Her experience with Omicron is anecdotal, but she does have cause for cautious optimism.\u00a0", "", "
The Omicron variant was first detected by scientists in southern Africa, but the origins are unclear.\u00a0(AP:\u00a0Jerome Delay)
", "\"The majority of patients that we are seeing have mild symptoms,\" she said", "One mystery that will likely take more time to solve is where Omicron originated.\u00a0", "Although it was first detected in Botswana and South Africa, earlier cases have since been reported in other countries.", "Some have speculated it could have mutated inside a person with an already weakened immune system because of an HIV infection.", "The immunocompromised\u00a0tend to have viral infections persist for longer, increasingly the likelihood of a mutation\u00a0occurring.", "It's possible that higher rates of HIV in southern Africa, coupled with low COVID-19 vaccination rates, could have created an environment where the new variant was more likely to mutate.", "But there is\u00a0simply no evidence this has actually happened, according to\u00a0Professor Ndung'u.\u00a0", "\"At the moment, I think the scientific evidence for that is sketchy,\" he said.\u00a0", "\"But it's certainly a very important issue because of the fact that we have high HIV infection rates in southern Africa.\"\u00a0", "
'The world is paying the price'\u00a0
", "Whether Omicron will be able to evade immunity from vaccines or prior infection is unknown, and a clearer picture of that could significantly influence governments' approaches to vaccine rollouts around the world.", "In South Africa, where only 24 per cent of those eligible are double-vaxxed, the emergence of Omicron has underscored the dire need for more equitable access to vaccines.", "\"It's quite simple,\" said Dr Michael Head, a public health researcher from the University of Southampton.", "\"The world is to some extent paying the price for not supporting sub-Saharan Africa in terms of donating vaccine doses quicker and earlier.\"", "", "
The number of infections is rising in South Africa, but it's not yet clear whether it's being fuelled by the Omicron variant.\u00a0(AP:\u00a0Jerome Delay)
", "Omicron's spread in a country like South Africa with low vaccination rates resembles what happened earlier this year in India with the Delta variant, said Andrea Taylor, a researcher at the Duke Global Health Institute, which tracks vaccine access around the world.", "\"This was unfortunately entirely predictable,\" she said.", "\"The inequity in vaccine access is allowing uncontrolled transmission of the virus in Africa, which then leads to new variants.\"", "
Will the world get boosters now?\u00a0
", "The rise of a new variant has forced experts in wealthier countries, including the United States, to reconsider the need of booster shots where previously they had been wary to endorse them without further evidence.", "Australian authorities say they won't speed up the booster program for most people, despite Omicron concerns.\u00a0", "In Israel, the first country to widely distribute booster shots to teenagers and adults, the population might enjoy much better immunity to Omicron, said Professor Nadav Davidovitch, a public health physician at Ben Gurion University.", "\"Israel has an excellent vaccination campaign, so in this sense we are better prepared,\" he said.", "\"Probably the vaccine won't be exactly covering the variant. But there will be some coverage for sure.\"", "", "
Experts in South Africa are now racing to discover whether the Omicron variant will have some resistance to existing vaccines.\u00a0(AP:\u00a0Denis Farrell)
", "Either way, even if we know very little now about Omicron, the coming days and weeks will prove critical to improving our understanding.", "The priority for Professor Ndung'u and his team remains figuring out a way to grow the new variant of the coronavirus in their lab.", "\"This is important information that we are trying to generate for the world,\" he said.\u00a0", "\"There's a weight of responsibility that comes with it, and you want to make sure that you get it right.\"\u00a0", "", "
Heavily mutated Omicron variant puts scientist on alert
"]
